args: Does this describe a specific, new, official action or formal announcement already taken/made by the Trump administration? Answer only "yes" or "no". Trump plans to further restrict undocumented immigrants from public benefits President Donald Trump plans to sign an executive order Wednesday evening aimed at restricting undocumented immigrants’ access to financial benefits from federally funded programs, though they already are generally ineligible for most federal public benefits. White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt confirmed Trump’s plans to sign the executive order on X, reposting a report from Fox News reporter Bill Melugin that said the order “will direct every federal agency & department to identify all federally funded programs currently providing any financial benefits to illegal aliens, and ‘take corrective action.’” The action, according to Melugin’s reporting, may be designed to target immigrants who are granted humanitarian parole by the U.S. Department of Homeland Security. Along with lawful permanent residents, refugees, people granted asylum and victims of abuse or trafficking, people with parole have access to additional benefits, but are still excluded in many cases, according to the National Immigration Law Center. Some of the benefits available to people regardless of immigration status include emergency disaster assistance, school breakfast and lunch programs and certain public health programs, according to the NILC.
